comments.body: note to self: this is guarded by `--cgroups-per-qos` flag as well: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubelet/cm/container_manager_linux.go#L482-L490
Yes, qosContainerManagerImpl is used only when --cgroups-per-qos is set to true.
Could this lead to the overcommit for hugepage at the node level?
No.  We enforce via validation of pod spec that over-commit is not allowed.
Curious: Why not read the value in `memory.limit_in_bytes` to validate it against the expectations?
`limit_in_bytes` might not be exactly the value we set it to due to the kernel page aligning the value.  plus if it doesn't match what we expect (within a page) then we need the usage value anyway.
